H0.text: Public opinion in favor of a revised theory is a reason that scientists revise theories.

H1.text: Corporate sponsorship of a revised theory is a reason that scientists revise theories.

H2.text: Government policy based on a revised theory is a reason that scientists revise theories.

H3.text: Experimental results that support a revised theory are a reason that scientists revise theories.

A4.text: If such evidence is found, a new theory may be proposed, or (more commonly) it is found that modifications to the previous theory are sufficient to explain the new evidence.
